name.text: Select the appropriate term in the second column to complete the sentences.

questiontext.text: Select the appropriate term in the second column to complete the sentences.

subquestion.text: Type sizes are usually expressed in _______________.
When a password must be entered in upper or lowercase in order to match the original password, it is said to be _______________.
Symbolic representations of objects and processes common to the graphical user interfaces of many computer operating systems are called _______________.
Special HTML characters, always prefixed by an ampersand (escape) and followed by a semicolon, are called _______________.
"What you see is what you get" is spoken as _______________.
Translating or designing multimedia (or any computer-based material) into a language other than the one in which it was originally written is called _______________.
The little decoration at the end of a letter stroke is a _______________.
Designers call roomy blank areas _______________.
_______________ blends the colors along the edges of the letters (called dithering) to create a soft transition between the letter and its background.
Conceptual elements consisting of text, graphics, sounds, or related information in the knowledge base are called _______________.

name.text: A family of graphic characters that usually includes many type sizes and ...

questiontext.text: A family of graphic characters that usually includes many type sizes and styles is called a:

name.text: A printed page might be presented in which of these orientations?

questiontext.text: A printed page might be presented in which of these orientations?

name.text: Dynamic HTML uses _______ to define choices ranging from line height to ...

questiontext.text: Dynamic HTML uses _______ to define choices ranging from line height to margin width to font face.

name.text: If a DHTML document includes a font face that is not installed on the user's ...

questiontext.text: If a DHTML document includes a font face that is not installed on the user's computer, a browser will:

answer.text: leave a blank space where that text is
try to substitute the font with a similar looking font

name.text: In the URL http://www.timestream.com/info/people/biotay/biotay1.html, which ...

questiontext.text: In the URL http://www.timestream.com/info/people/biotay/biotay1.html, which part is case sensitive?

name.text: Interactive multimedia becomes hypermedia when:

questiontext.text: Interactive multimedia becomes hypermedia when:

answer.text: the information is available on the Web—either the Internet or a local area network
quizzes and tests with evaluations and scoring are included
it includes a structure of linked elements through which a user can navigate and interact
the user can change such attributes as volume and type size
the content formatting complies with the American Standard Code for Information Interchange

name.text: Intercapping, the practice of placing a capital in the middle of a word, is a...

questiontext.text: Intercapping, the practice of placing a capital in the middle of a word, is a trend that emerged from the computer programming community because:

answer.text: they wanted to copy marketing practices in the electronics industry
they found they could see the words used for variables and commands better
one of the first computer programmers had a faulty shift key on his keyboard
it increases security in case-sensitive passwords

name.text: Multimedia becomes interactive multimedia when:

questiontext.text: Multimedia becomes interactive multimedia when:

answer.text: the user has some control over what information is viewed and when it is viewed
the information is displayed by a computer with a touchscreen or other input device
the information is available on the Web—either the Internet or a local area network
quizzes and tests with evaluations and scoring are included
the user can change such attributes as volume and type size

name.text: The reference from one document to another document, image, sound, or file on...

questiontext.text: The reference from one document to another document, image, sound, or file on the Web is a(n):

name.text: Web pages are coded using:

questiontext.text: Web pages are coded using:

answer.text: American Standard Code for Information Interchange

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a character encoding system?

name.text: Which of the following is a problem that might apply to hypermedia?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a problem that might apply to hypermedia?

answer.text: Users' eye movements affect their ability to link.
Users will be turned off by excessive animation.
Hypermedia software might create inappropriate links.
Current hyperlinking technology far exceeds what today's desktop computers can handle.
Search results generally are too granular to be useful.

name.text: Which of the following is a term that applies to the spacing between ...

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a term that applies to the spacing between characters of text?

name.text: Which of the following is a typical method for word searching in a hypermedia...

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a typical method for word searching in a hypermedia system?

name.text: Which of the following provides a system for dynamically displaying a font?

questiontext.text: Which of the following provides a system for dynamically displaying a font?

name.text: Matching Type

questiontext.text: Matching Type

subquestion.text: The working area of a computer display is sometimes called _______________.
The type of image used for photo-realistic images and for complex drawings requiring fine detail is the _______________.
The type of image used for lines, boxes, circles, polygons, and other graphic shapes that can be mathematically expressed in angles, coordinates, and distances is the ____________.
The picture elements that make up a bitmap are called _______________.
_______________ allows you to smoothly blend two images so that one image seems to melt into the next.
The process that computes the bounds of the shapes of colors within a bitmap image and then derives the polygon object that describes that image is called _____________.
_______________ is when the computer uses intricate algorithms to apply the effects you have specified on the objects you have created for a final 3-D image.
________________ is the blocky, jagged look resulting from too little information in a bitmapped image.
A collection of color values available for display is called a _______________.
_______________ is a process whereby the color value of each pixel is changed to the closest matching color value in the target palette, using a mathematical algorithm.

name.text: "Unlimited use" of stock photography may actually impose a limitation on:

questiontext.text: "Unlimited use" of stock photography may actually impose a limitation on:

answer.text: the number of units you can distribute without paying more.
the number of changes you can make to the image.
converting the image to another file format.
the filters you may use to alter the image.
the price you can charge for your product.

name.text: A 24-bit image is capable of representing how many different colors?

questiontext.text: A 24-bit image is capable of representing how many different colors?

name.text: A GIF image may contain:

questiontext.text: A GIF image may contain:

answer.text: 8 bits of color information per pixel
16 bits of color information per pixel
24 bits of color information per pixel
32 bits of color information per pixel
48 bits of color information per pixel

name.text: Graphic artists designing for print media use vector-drawn objects because:

questiontext.text: Graphic artists designing for print media use vector-drawn objects because:

answer.text: they can contain more subtle variations in shading than bitmap graphics
printing inks respond better to them
they can be converted across platforms more easily
they can be scaled to print at any size
they can be viewed directly in Web browsers

questiontext.text: What is the best way to start creating your project's interface?

answer.text: Start with pencil, eraser, and paper.
Outline your project and graphic ideas.
Use three-by-five index cards and shuffle them.

name.text: When an image created on a Macintosh is viewed on a PC:

questiontext.text: When an image created on a Macintosh is viewed on a PC:

answer.text: it appears darker and richer because the values have changed
it appears lighter and less saturated because the values have changed
it appears darker and richer even though the values have not changed
it appears lighter and less saturated even though the values have not changed

name.text: Removing blank space or "dead air" at the beginning or end of a recording is ...

questiontext.text: Removing blank space or "dead air" at the beginning or end of a recording is sometimes called:

name.text: Sequencing software:

questiontext.text: Sequencing software:

answer.text: places audio clips in order in a soundtrack
applies filters to digital audio clips in a predetermined order
manages a project by creating a timeline of events
helps synchronize images with a sound track

name.text: Some software allows you to begin playing a downloading sound file as soon as...

questiontext.text: Some software allows you to begin playing a downloading sound file as soon as enough of the sound is cached in your computer's _______________.

name.text: The file format that uses a shorthand representation of musical notes and ...

questiontext.text: The file format that uses a shorthand representation of musical notes and durations stored in numeric form is:

name.text: The file size of a five-second recording sampled at 22 kHz, 16-bit stereo ...

name.text: The primary benefit of the General MIDI over the previous MIDI specification ...

questiontext.text: The primary benefit of the General MIDI over the previous MIDI specification is that:

answer.text: the file sizes are much smaller due to the compression scheme
users can easily edit and adjust the data structures
it can be easily converted into the CDROM/XA format
MIDI files can be easily integrated into the computer's operating system as system sounds
the instruments are the same regardless of the playback source

name.text: The process of playing a sound file while part of the file is still ...

questiontext.text: The process of playing a sound file while part of the file is still downloading is called _______________.

name.text: The process of recording a sound, stored in the form of thousands of ...

questiontext.text: The process of recording a sound, stored in the form of thousands of individual measurements, each at a discrete point in time, is called:

name.text: The Red Book standard was so named because:

questiontext.text: The Red Book standard was so named because:

answer.text: the standard was pioneered in the former Soviet Union
red is an acronym for "Registered Electronic Data"
the standard's book jacket was red
it was so expensive to produce CDs early on that most producers were "in the red"
the dye in the first recordable CDs had a reddish tint

name.text: The slower a user's connection, the longer he must wait for enough of the ...

questiontext.text: The slower a user's connection, the longer he must wait for enough of the sound to download so that the entire file will have downloaded by the time the sound reaches the end. This effect is called:

name.text: The standard file format for displaying digitized motion video on the ...

questiontext.text: The standard file format for displaying digitized motion video on the Macintosh is _______________.

name.text: To adjust the level of a number of tracks to bring them all up to about the ...

questiontext.text: To adjust the level of a number of tracks to bring them all up to about the same level is to _______________ them.

name.text: What happens when an audio signal exceeds the recording device's maximum ...

questiontext.text: What happens when an audio signal exceeds the recording device's maximum recording level?

answer.text: The signal is compressed to an appropriate level.
Clipping of the signal occurs, introducing distortion.
The audio clip is extended to accommodate the extra data.
The entire clip's volume is reduced correspondingly.
The extra bits go into a buffer for later use.

name.text: When audio is measured in order to be digitally stored, the value of each ...

questiontext.text: When audio is measured in order to be digitally stored, the value of each measurement is rounded off to the nearest integer in a process called _______________.

name.text: Which of the following sound file characteristics does not directly affect ...

questiontext.text: Which of the following sound file characteristics does not directly affect the size of a digital audio file?

name.text: Which of these statements regarding the MIDI audio format is not true?

questiontext.text: Which of these statements regarding the MIDI audio format is not true?

answer.text: The sound can easily be changed by changing instruments.
Spoken audio can easily be included.
Sound tracks can be created using sequencing software.
Files are generally smaller than the same digital audio sound.
Sounds can be stretched and timing changed with no distortion of the quality.
